In a few years the town was increased by the accession of Indians, won over by Fathers Antonio Planes, Thaddeus Emis, a Bohemian, and Antonino Cortada, after arduous journeys amid pathless wilds. In 1767 it contained upwards of two thousand three hundred inhabi- tants, who had formerly wandered over those woods, where the Spaniards gather the herb of Paraguay.
